senses.de: Something that prepares or makes you suitable for a particular job, activity, or task
senses.ex: A degree or any other qualification is required for this job.

Tips.title: Beyond Academia
Tips.description: Qualifications include work experience and skills, not just degrees.
Tips.example: Her extensive volunteer work was a valuable qualification for the role.

Tips.title: Varying Relevance
Tips.description: Different jobs require different qualifications; tailor your application accordingly.
Tips.example: While applying for the marketing job, he highlighted his qualification in digital advertising.

Tips.title: Cultural Differences
Tips.description: Qualifications may be named or recognized differently in other countries.
Tips.example: In the UK, an MBA is a prestigious qualification, much like in the US.

senses.de: A condition or requirement that must be met
senses.ex: You need to meet certain qualifications to apply for this program.

Tips.title: Baseline Standards
Tips.description: Qualifications can be minimum standards you must meet for consideration.
Tips.example: Basic computer proficiency is a qualification for the office assistant position.

Tips.title: Varied Forms
Tips.description: Qualifications can include tests, licenses, or certificates, not just experiences.
Tips.example: A driver's license is a key qualification for a delivery driver.

senses.de: A restriction or limitation on a statement
senses.ex: He made his argument with several qualifications to limit its scope.

Tips.title: Clarifying Statements
Tips.description: Use qualification to make your statements more precise and avoid generalization.
Tips.example: He supported his claims with the qualification that the study was preliminary.

Tips.title: Academic Writing
Tips.description: In essays, use qualifications to acknowledge counterarguments or limitations.
Tips.example: The theory, with the qualification of lacking empirical evidence, remains contested.

senses.de: The act of qualifying for something
senses.ex: Her qualification for the Olympics was a dream come true.

Tips.title: Accomplishment Highlight
Tips.description: Qualification for an event signifies an accomplishment or a level of skill.
Tips.example: Her qualification for the national debate team showcased her speaking abilities.

Tips.title: Process Emphasis
Tips.description: Highlight the process it takes to achieve qualification for an event or position.
Tips.example: Years of training led to his qualification for the world championships.

Accreditation.wordDefinition:
Accreditation is the process of recognizing and approving an institution or program as meeting certain standards. It is applicable to universities, colleges, and other education providers, as well as professional associations and organizations.

Accreditation ensures that the institution or program meets specific quality criteria and that graduates of these programs possess specified skills and knowledge.

Accreditation is a process that recognizes institutions and programs that meet certain standards, while qualification is a measure of an individual's skills and knowledge in a particular area.

Approval.wordDefinition:
Approval refers to giving permission or agreement to something. For example, a parent approves of their child's request to go to a party.

Approval is often given by someone in a position of authority or someone who has the power to grant permission.

Approval is when someone gives permission or agreement to something, while qualification is when someone has the necessary skills or requirements for something.

Certificate.wordDefinition:
A certificate is a document that confirms you have completed a course or training program. It shows that you have gained specific knowledge or skills in a particular area.

Certificates are often given for short-term courses or workshops that focus on a particular skill or subject.

A qualification refers to a level of achievement like a degree, diploma, or professional certification. It means that the holder has completed a full program of study and has achieved a certain level of expertise in a particular field.

To summarise, certificates are awarded for short courses and workshops, while qualifications are awarded for completing a full program of study, and they demonstrate a higher level of skill and knowledge.

Credential.wordDefinition:
A credential is a document that proves a person's identity or qualifications, such as a passport, driver's license or diploma.

A credential is a document that proves who you are or who you say you are, while a qualification refers to the skills and knowledge you have that make you suitable for a particular job or task.

Degree.wordDefinition:
A degree is a type of qualification that you can earn by completing a program of study at a university or college. It usually takes several years of full-time study to earn a degree, and when you graduate, you'll have a certificate or diploma that shows you've completed the program.

A degree is a specific type of qualification that you earn through higher education, while a qualification is a more general term that can refer to any type of recognition of skills or knowledge.

Diploma.wordDefinition:
A diploma is a certificate that you receive after completing a specific course of study, such as a high school diploma or a diploma in nursing.

A diploma is applicable to specific courses of study, whereas a qualification can apply to a broader range of skills and education levels.

For example, a high school diploma is a specific type of diploma that is awarded after completing high school, while a nursing qualification may include several different levels of certification and training.

Endorse.wordDefinition:
Endorse means to publicly declare support or approval of someone or something. This may be applicable in the context of endorsing a political candidate or endorsing a certain product or brand.

Endorse is about giving support or approval, while qualification is about meeting necessary requirements to fulfill a certain role or task.

License.wordDefinition:
License is a legal document that gives one the permission to perform a certain activity or carry out a certain profession.

For example, a driver's license gives you the right to drive a car legally.

A license is issued by a government authority, and it is mandatory to have one if you want to pursue a specific line of work or perform an activity in some capacity.

To summarize, a license is required by law, while a qualification is not.

A license gives permission to engage in a specific activity, while a qualification demonstrates expertise in a particular area.

quotes.Text: My major regret in life is not going to university, though not for the qualification I would have gained. People I know who went there have a working method where they sit down and get something done; they know how to start and get on with things. I will do anything to avoid getting on with stuff.
quotes.Title: English Comedian
quotes.Name: Sean Lock

quotes.Text: It's one of the main things that I love about my job. You are never playing yourself, so I really love that I get to be someone else, play a different character and take on that persona, but I also have to take on their qualifications.
quotes.Title: British Actress
quotes.Name: Sasha Jackson

quotes.Text: There's more to life than passing exams, and paper qualifications can only take you so far. A lot depends on luck, and on being in the right place at the right time, which was certainly true in my case.
quotes.Title: Irish Entertainer
quotes.Name: Terry Wogan

quotes.Text: Always know your merit and how special you are, and don't let someone else's qualifications make you feel small. If you stick to this, you will always deserve their respect.
quotes.Title: American Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Whitney Wolfe Herd

quotes.Text: What office is there which involves more responsibility, which requires more qualifications, and which ought, therefore, to be more honorable, than that of teaching?
quotes.Title: English Writer
quotes.Name: Harriet Martineau

quotes.Text: All men will commence in their present rank and promotion will be open to all men alike, without any distinctions or qualifications, political or otherwise.
quotes.Title: British Politician
quotes.Name: John Amery

quotes.Text: Good education is so important. We do need to look at the way people are taught. It not just about qualifications to get a job. It's about being educated.
quotes.Title: British Architect
quotes.Name: Zaha Hadid

quotes.Text: At one time I thought he wanted to be an actor. He had certain qualifications, including no money and a total lack of responsibility.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Hedda Hopper

quotes.Text: Academic qualifications are important and so is financial education. They're both important and schools are forgetting one of them.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Robert Kiyosaki

quotes.Text: The companion of an evening, and the companion for life, require very different qualifications.
quotes.Title: English Novelist
quotes.Name: Samuel Richardson
